title: Brandi Carlile - The Story
description:
The Story, was released in April 2007. It was produced by T Bone Burnett and includes a collaboration with the Indigo Girls on "Cannonball." The album was recorded in an eleven-day-long session with Carlile, the twins (Tim and Phil Hanseroth), cellist Josh Neumann and drummer Matt Chamberlain to capture the sound of Carlile&#039;s live performances. The crack in Carlile&#039;s vocals during the title track, "The Story", came out by accident and was a direct result of the way the album was recorded. Carlile herself describes the vocals as "technically wrong but emotionally right."[8] She would also contribute vocals to "Last Tears" from Indigo Girls&#039; Despite Our Differences.

Carlile was exposed to a wider audience when ABC&#039;s Grey&#039;s Anatomy showcased three of her songs: "Tragedy," "What Can I Say," and "Throw It All Away". In April 2007, Grey&#039;s Anatomy debuted a version of the video for the single The Story interspersed with footage from the show. On May 3, 2007, a special two-hour episode of "Grey&#039;s Anatomy" featured Carlile&#039;s song "Turpentine" during footage of the "Grey&#039;s Anatomy" spin-off, Private Practice.
